conclusion: A 5m wooden rod is suspended from a fixed point.
The rod is released from rest and falls freely (no air resistance).
The rod must pass through cylinder AB positioned 20m below the suspension point.
Need to find time t₁ when the rod passes through point A (upper end of cylinder).

premise: The bottom end of the rod reaches point A after falling a distance of 15m.
conclusion: Using the free fall equation: 15m = ½(10 m/s²)t², t² = 3s², t = √3s ≈ 1.732s.

premise: The top end of the rod needs to fall a total distance of 20m to completely pass through point A.
conclusion: Using the free fall equation: 20m = ½(10 m/s²)t², t² = 4s², t = 2s.

premise: The time t₁ it takes for the rod to pass through point A is the difference between when the top of the rod passes point A and when the bottom of the rod first reaches point A.
The calculated time t₁ for the wooden rod to pass through the upper end A of the cylinder.
conclusion: The time t₁ is exactly 2 - √3 seconds.
